text: Charlie Tyrell (born 1988) is a Canadian film director."A portrait of a lost parent". Hamilton Spectator, January 24, 2019. He is most noted for his short documentary film My Dead Dad's Porno Tapes, which won the Canadian Screen Award for Best Short Documentary at the 7th Canadian Screen Awards."Les Québécois remportent plus de la moitié des trophées à l'avant-gala des prix Écrans canadiens". Ici Radio-Canada, March 31, 2019. Born and raised in Hamilton, Ontario, Tyrell studied film at Ryerson University. In addition to narrative and documentary short films, he has directed music videos for Harrison, The Precious Lo's, Keita Juma and McCallaman. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1988 births Category:Canadian documentary film directors Category:Canadian music video directors Category:Directors of Genie and Canadian Screen Award winners for Best Short Documentary Film Category:Film directors from Ontario Category:Ryerson University alumni Category:People from Hamilton, Ontario Category:Living people
title: Charlie Tyrell
